meanings.definition: A state of deep sleep or unconsciousness.
meanings.sent1: After a long day of playing outside, the child fell into a deep dor.
meanings.sent2: The bear went into a dor in its cozy cave for the winter.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked so peaceful in its dor, dreaming of chasing mice.
meanings.sent4: The city was in a dor of silence as the snow fell softly on the streets.
meanings.sent5: The dor enveloped her like a warm blanket, calming her mind and body.

meanings.definition: A unit of measurement for the loudness of sound.
meanings.sent1: The concert was so loud, it reached a dor that made everyone dance.
meanings.sent2: The thunderstorm outside reached a dor that shook the windows.
meanings.sent3: The laughter from the comedy show hit a dor that echoed through the theater.
meanings.sent4: The roar of the lion at the zoo hit a dor that made the visitors jump.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks created a dor in the sky that lit up the night.

meanings.definition: To be reluctant or slow to do something.
meanings.sent1: She would dor to clean her room, preferring to read her book instead.
meanings.sent2: The dog seemed to dor when called to come inside from the yard.
meanings.sent3: The student would dor to raise their hand in class, feeling shy.
meanings.sent4: The old car would dor to start on cold mornings, needing extra time.
meanings.sent5: He would dor to make a decision, wanting to think it over carefully.
